Reviews.Title: “breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kamiel M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast at the room! No table nor chairs in room available. The breakfast : biscots, bread from the supermarket, butter, jam and fruitjuice. no cheese nor meat to eat with the bread. The cappucino was good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpfull”
Reviews.Author: Gillian B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had never before stayed in a hotel that was upstairs and layed out in such a way and were a little apprehensive to start with. As the staff were so friendly and helpfull, we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base with great local amenities”
Reviews.Author: JemnTom
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in January 2012. Beautiful rooms - comfortable 4 poster bed, a bath with hydro/bubbles included, LCD TV with lots of channels (we had Virgin TV on for background music when in the room). Large fridge in room (not too loud) for storing your own items (mini bar was really good if you needed - 1 euro for beer/water/soft drink. Bottle of Asti and cocktail nibbles on arrival. Good breakfast - the same every morning but good start to the day. We had coffee, croissant, toast things with jam and fruit juice drink (not fresh). We found the room a little hot, we turned off the heating in the room and it was still very warm when we came in the room - opening the windows we could see Vatican city walls if we stuck our heads out (the large drop was a bit scary though!) Opposite the road is a little restaurant, cocktail bar, takeaway pizza place, ice cream bar - all great value. Parenti Patisserie was a god send - 1 euro a coffee and 1 euro for a little taste of heaven cake. Great value stay! Warning - Old lift that hold two people and one suitcase maximum! Ok to walk down the stairs but its on floor 5 (I think) of historic building so not good for the wheelchair user. A great base for tourists wanting to explore the city. We would highly recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in the area. There is a metro about 5 minutes walk away from here but we were lucky with weather so walked all over the city!

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: Tom B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect locatIon, decent accommodation, disappointing breakfast. Apparently this review isn't long enough so I'll ramble on a bit more. Frankly I think that's a bit cheeky really though. Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah

Reviews.Title: “JR from Crawley, UK”
Reviews.Author: JosefinaR_12 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Filipino staff give their very best good service as usual. I have a teenager and a 5 years old with me who felt at home. Walking distance to Metro (underground train), Vatican City, Chinese restaurant round the square corner, a family run restaurant at the end corner of the Via Gracchi and within the vicinity of shopping area (includes designers). Have a small lift enough for your luggage to carry up to fourth floor. Breakfast is carried inside your room as there is no space for breakfast table outside the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in the snow”
Reviews.Author: Claire P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but perfectly formed, the staff extremely friendly. The lift is small - don't bring too much luggage - but the hotel is perfectly placed for the metro and for the Vatican. A map or a more descriptive diagram of the front door may help. It was very clean and for what we paid, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad if you know what to expect...”
Reviews.Author: Wema34
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great location, walking disctance to the Vatican, restaurants & shops are close by, train station is a short distance away. Clean rooms Good service Wifi works well and is free Negatives:- Not your typical hotel, its situated on the 4th floor of a building, has a very small lift and may not be ideal for a family with children. Small bathroom and has a step that could be dangerous when wet. Breakfast is the same throughout, its served in the room (positive!) but I guess its because there's no dining room at the hotel. Summary: Not too bad if you know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Last Moment, Good Decision”
Reviews.Author: MBSalomone
Reviews.Content: For the Rome portion of our trip we planned to drive from Umbria, tour Rome and drive back for two days in a row. The family had enough driving so the night before we decided to take the train in and spend the night. We did the double-decker bus tour of Rome and halfway through the day I remembered we didn't have anywhere to stay that night. We wanted a place by the Vatican so we could rise early and go to the Museo Vatico then go to the Basilica. On the Bus I turned on my rented MIFI (another great decision while traveling) and found Le Suite di Via Ottaviano. The B&B is quaint and as described more like an apartment. It is in a residential building and some searching was needed. We were greeted very warmly and felt very welcome. We had two rooms, one for our older and one for us. The rooms were comfortable and accommodating. The area is not loaded with Hotels so by night the Tourists leave and we experienced Rome as if we lived there. Great restaurants in the area. One block from Mero that took us back to Roma Temini for the Train.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL”
Reviews.Author: ShelaghC65
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for our stay 8-10 Nov. We had room 1 which has the spectacular view of the Popes place! The room was lovely, clean, spacious, bed + pillows comfy, sparkly wine on arrival which was a lovely touch, just ideal really. Breakfast served in room whatever time u like, which was great. The other couple had the 4 poster room which was smaller but still ideal for a short stay. Location excellent, few minute walk to the metro, taxi rank round the corner. The staff were friendly and Angelo the owner was very helpful showing us where to go etc. Great little hotel, we have only good things to say. Some people are probably just too picky when i've read their reviews. You dont spend much time in your hotel when you go away for a few days anyway

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: GolfIT
Reviews.Content: You can see the vatican walls from your room and is a great location for the Vatican City. The rooms are clean and tiny. The staff and the service were very friendly and well done. I think these rooms were 22 sq m. Good price for being in Rome, but if you are looking for a little bit more space, this would not be the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: lidcim
Reviews.Content: Tthe kindest most helpful staff.... vey clean and compact rooms. Great location close to the Vatican, shopping, metro and restaurants. Definitaly Great value for the money. .

Reviews.Title: “where else can you have brekkie overlooking the popes bedroom?!”
Reviews.Author: pinksacha
Reviews.Content: fantastic location. As soon as you enter the apartment you see a lovely hallway, very stylish and maintained impeccably, with a fragrant candle on.We were in room 1 , was set out for the 3 of us, lovely comfy double bed and a single for our teenage daughter. All furnishing modern and comfy with the welcome addition of a fridge with reasonably priced drinks available (water just a euro and a mini proseccco for 2!). small but well maintained bathroom with a lovely power shower. No sooner had we started to unpack than a knock at the door was heard; the check in guy presented us with a lovely chilled bottle of proseccco with some nuts and bar snacks. Just lovely, very thoughtful. The room already had a little boiled sweetie jar and these little touches put this B&B head and shoulders above others we have stayed in. It is a stones throw from the Vatican with a side of view, meaning that from our room you are actually seeing a back window of the papal apartment and bedroom. Staff gave good advice including local restaurants. can not wait to go back to see all of Rome as 2 days was no way long enough and we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: gosal1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in June. This hotel is in a great location right next to the vatican and metro stop. The hotel is clean and tidy and you get given a set of keys so you can come and go as you please. The staff are very friendly and polite and accomodate to your needs. We would come back to this hotel and certainly recommend it. if you would like more information, do not hesitate to email me at suk_80@hotmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - just have your expectations correc”
Reviews.Author: rokopuri
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel in April 2011. It was gorgeous! The staff were friendly, the gentleman there during the day didn't speak a whole lot of English, but he tried, and we were pretty ignorant in our communication. I think a lot of the time American travellers have their expectations set wrong when they go traveling in Europe; this "hotel" is located in the 3rd floor of a terraced building in Vatican City. It's on the third floor, but there is a working elevator so no need to panic, although I'm not sure how much luggage can fit in there...We were two adults with two carry ons and there wasn't room for even a flea to squeeze in. The room was clean and actually a lot roomier than what we were expecting for the price (137Euro's per night plus tax). The bathroom was also larger than I expected in whole, although the shower itself was fine for me, husband is 6'3 and a little larger, so I know he ended up with a few bruises after showering each day. The view was gorgeous, the location was ideal for us, if we ever go back to Roma this is where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KandDManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first week of July 2010. weather was amazing. the B&B is in the perfect location 2mins walk from vatican museum and St Peters cathedral. 5mins walk from Ottaviano metro station. The room was clean and spacious. the staff were freindly and always available. It's in the perfect location to all the shops and restaurants. The only niggle i would have is that the there was no bath, only a shower which was a little small but otherwise adequate. We had an amazing time and would definitely recommend it to friends and family. overall... loved it!

Reviews.Title: “watch what room type you book and don't let them walk you down the street”
Reviews.Author: George_and_Tamara
Reviews.Content: First I will tell you about the only 2 things good about this hotel. The staff had good recommendations for restaurants and the location was good. Now about the bad They first took us away (down the street) to a hotel room that was not what we paid for. That room had filthy dirty walls, wilted roses and an ancient bedspread. When we argued about the room we were supposed to have vs the room that we were put into, we were eventually moved to another room back in the original building. This room was slightly nicer, with cleaner walls and roses that were not wilted, although the washroom was poorly designed (I fell down the stairs in the washroom and hurt my hip, and all the hotel staff said about that was "oh".

Reviews.Title: “better than the average for Rome accommodation”
Reviews.Author: NiallFlynn
Reviews.Content: It was a good location, especially near the Vatican, however the entrance to the place was a bit hard to find. The lift only had enough room for 1 person but we guess its part of the charm. Also the bathroom was a bit tiny.The guy who ran the place was really helpful and knowledgeable with the restaurants. For a short stay it was well priced and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: GLCB_10
Reviews.Content: What a City, what a place - fell in love with Rome big time!. The apartments are of a very high quality and as previously mentioned only 5mins walk from St Peters. We were shuttled across the road but I must say that the room was excellent. Exceptionally clean, comfortable with a fabulous shower and gorgeous shutter windows looking out to a lovely view. Breakfast was delicious(very fresh and loads of it) and served to the room which was a real treat. Angelo and staff were very friendly and his advise and recommendations on restaurants/bars was spot on - excellent quality and superb value for money! Watch out for the more expensive piazzas and places directly around the Vatican, but that's only common sense. Can't get back to Rome quick enough and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: spikysonic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ottaviano for 5 nights. Check in was very informal and quick. The room had everything it said on the tin, was clean and warm. The location was brilliant. The staff were helpful when needed. €95 was quite expensive in my opinion, but then again this is central Rome and I'm a firm believer you get what you pay for. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room not in the hotel we booked!”
Reviews.Author: CWilliamsChester_UK
Reviews.Content: We booked this accommodation as part of our stay in Italy and were very disappointed. We had carried our bags in the heat from the station to the hotel only to find that when we arrived at the hotel at 2.30, the room was not in the hotel we had booked. We were ushered across the street to a small shop where the owner greeted us who explained that this room would be his new office. He said that we could leave our bags in there and that if we came back at 3 our room would be ready. At 3 we returned and we again went to the office. This time a lady met us and walked us down the street to the other end into another building - not the hotel we had booked but another one it seems the gentleman owned. We think it was called "My Rooms". The room itself was new - too new infact. Some plug sockets had not been installed so there were holes in the wall with bare wires - not good! Our B&B actually consisted of the room and then a voucher to get a croissant and a coffee but it was not clear where we actually got that breakfast from as the accommodation was a room in an apartment so we ended up not using the vouchers. Check out strangely had to happen the night before although we were not advised this until we were visited by the owners 'assistant' that evening. All in all not a great experience although location was great as right next to Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “unique 'hotel'”
Reviews.Author: rachie1
Reviews.Content: Ok lets start with the fact that this isnt a 'hotel' as such, its on the fourth floor of a residential block, there is no reception or anything like that, and i was really really surprised at first i almost left but im so glad we didnt! The Ottaviano is down a tree lined street, really close to the metro station, vatican and St Peters Basilica, in fact we could see the vatican from our room so location wise perfect! When we arrived after my inital shock of not having a reception we we're met by the manager and taken to our room which was beautiful. A four poster bed, decorated to a high standard, lovely shuttered windows etc. The bathroom was very small but had a whirlpool bath so that was a nice touch. We have read that unless you book a 'superior' room your sent across the road to another building, and in that case i agree with some of negative reviews id be seriously annoyed at that too! Breakfast for us was taken in the little cafe across the road which was odd, we were given a card and went down there each morning but the breakfast was fine, lots of pastries and fruit, lovely italian coffee just enough to start us off! It was a surprising little find and id definitly stay there again, the only thing is we now have a little one and as the rooms are on the fourth floor and the access to it is either through a old fashioned gated lift (which is actually lovely, it runs up the middle of the spiral marble staircase) or the staircase...four floors?buggy?no dont think so! But as a romantic little getaway?definitly!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jnj1010
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, very close to metro, taxi stands, vatican etc. Lots of restaurants and shopping close by. Breakfast was always on time simple but perfect and served by a very nice gentleman. The drinks in the fridge were very affordable and actually cheaper than some places right outside. Angelo the owner welcomed us the first day and gave us some helpful suggestions. Also saw us of the last day and made sure that our ride to the airport was confirmed which was 50 euro. They also held our bags until 6pm since we had a late flight. We have a 15 year old boy and it was perfect for us. We stayed at the Westin Excelsior in 2005 and to be quite honest if you don't need the glam and just want something affordable, comfortable and with good service this is the one. I wished I found this place before, it was perfect for us. Just keep in mind the lift is kind of small, but we didn't mind doing the stairs. The rooms are on he 4th flr. Since we are americans we had a little problem with the portions at most of the restaurants. To be honest after walking all day we had pretty healthy appetites. There is a place about 3 or 4 short blocks on Via del Gracchi which is were the entrance is for the suites. It's called L'Antica Griglia Toscano get there around 7:30. Because after that its starts filling up with locals and believe me they hang around forever and customers keep comming in until midnight. They close about 1:00am. Make sure you go to the right retaurant because there is a well known restaurant close by call Dal Toscano pricer and portions smaller. Also get all your drinks and snacks from the small grocery stores on the small side streets and not the main road, major price difference

Reviews.Title: “Traveller Beware !”
Reviews.Author: dizzydispenser
Reviews.Content: Guests should be made aware that any 'standard room' that is booked, is actually in another building, not the building shown and not up to the quality that is shown in the photo's! Be prepared to be moved across the road. Rooms were not ready, and although it was obvious that the previous guests had not checked out, we were told to look and choose which room we wanted to have from a choice of two. One had a broken toilet seat, the other had a broken shower handle, which we thought was the lesser problem, only to find that it was also blocked! After bringing this to the attention of the staff member on duty, (not Angelo himself) we had to ask him to unblock it, which was met with a surly, silent attitude that continued for the rest of our stay. Angelo was very helpful in telling us where to eat and drink, he did offer us another room in another part of town, this would have been for our last night of a three night stay, and we didn't feel it was worth the effort of moving for one night. We felt that we had already wasted enough time waiting for our room to be ready, and the shower to be unblocked. I feel that he is well used to these complaints. Breakfast is missable. Although I have said that I would stay here again, it would only be for the great location, and this time, I would know what to expect, even so, I would look for a different hotel in this location. There were a number of other issues, but I feel as though we have already stated our case, and enough is enough!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: jellyjeb
Reviews.Content: On the day we arrived, we were told by Angelo that there was a problem with our bathroom and that we would need to be moved to another hotel across the other side of rome. This was frustrating as we'd booked Ottaviano so that we could be close to the Vatican for when we did our full day tour. Despite this we were cooperative and jumped in a cab that took us to the other hotel which luckily, was much nicer and it was right next to Trevi Fountain. The main thing that annoyed us was then being moved back to Ottiviano on day two after we'd settled in at the Trevi Suites. We asked if we could stay at Trevi but he said that he had other guests arriving soon that needed our room. Reading back on the reviews for this hotel I now know that the bathroom excuse was probably a load of bull as Angelo's used that plenty of times before. The likely reason is that the booking was stuffed up some how. Maybe it was the language barrier that caused a lot of misunderstanding but we found it hard to trust Angelo and for that reason I wont be recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star but not a “hotel””
Reviews.Author: Bellahols
Reviews.Content: Firstly the Le Suite di Via Ottaviano in my opinion isn’t a traditional hotel but more like an apartment. Le Suite di Via Ottaviano is on the 4th floor of a residential block where you get given a set of keys for the front doors to the block and hotel. This to us was not a problem and loved the fact that it was a little different. We were lucky enough to have the corner room which boasts a fantastic view of the Vatican. The room was very light and airy, breakfast (croissants, yoghurt and drink) was served in our room at our chosen time. The hotel is in a perfect location for the Vatican and transport networks, although it is easy enough to walk round Rome. Finally the staff could not do enough for us and really tried to make the stay as comfortable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful little gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Korimus
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in the heart of Rome. Literally 4 blocks from Metro stop Ottaviano, and just 1 block from the Vatican! We had their best suite, which was on the corner of the building and had a view of the Vatican. While I had heard so many great things about Angelo, I never saw him during our 4 night stay, but the staff that was there was very friendly. All in all a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for problems”
Reviews.Author: Gardner43
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel almost 8 months ahead, based on some very favorable reviews on Trip Advisor. I even confirmed our reservation via email a week or so ahead and was assured all was in order. We arrived at the door after taking the metro across town at the expected time, and were then informed there was a "problem with the bathroom" in the room we reserved & it could not be fixed until at least the following day. The manager/owner assured us that he would take us to a much better location which was "far superior and give us that room for the same amount we were to pay at Ottaviano." He took us by taxi to another small suite near Trevi fountain, which was in fact a very central location, and not wanting to pack up and move again, we remained there for the duration of our stay. The central location was good, but we had to relearn the area with regard to metro lines etc.The room was quite functional with excellent bed, air, bath, TV and other amenities. However, it was located on a side alley way and was dark due to other buildings abuting it. (The large sunlit windows in the photos of the Ottaviano hotel were what attracted us there in the first place.) The bottom line is this: There have been far too many similar instances noted in these reviews to believe it is an isolated occurence. Unless the Suites di Via Ottaviano are in much poorer condition that they appear from the photos, it is unlikely there are such frequent problems with bathrooms. Perhaps all the switches are due to overbooking. Since there were positive aspects to the alternate room we were given, I suggest that If you book this hotel, do so knowing that you may be switched at the last minute to an entirely different location due to "problems with the rooms". Since I did not get in the building of Le Suites di Via Ottaviano, I can't comment on the property other than perhaps the booking practices. The Asian man who brought us breakfast each morning was nice and helpful as could be and overall, it was a very good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out”
Reviews.Author: Johnson25
Reviews.Content: We booked the 4poster room for 4 nights. The hotel states that should you arrive no later than 9pm at night and if so you should contact them in advance. I did just that and received confirmation from Angelo the hotel manager. We arrived at 22:00 as stated in our email to find no-one answering. It is more like an apartment than a hotel (i.e. no Hotel front/reception etc..) We then called the mobile number provided but there was no answer. In the end we wandered the streets of rome around 22:30 until we found a hotel nearby. I then tried calling early in the morning. Angelo eventually answered, apologised and said firstly he had not received the email. Then when i confirmed he had, he then said he mixed his diary up!!! Apart from this the hotel was pretty much what we expected- good location & nice room; but it was not the start we were looking for. If you stay here, you'll probably be best taking Angelo up on his offer to ferry you from the airport for 45euros than chancing it!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne257
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the room with the four poster bed from 3 - 6 December 2007. All the glowing reviews are correct - it's a really nice place with a friendly, helpful owner and smiley staff. Our room was fairly small, but it was really cosy, and very well appointed with somewhere to put everything (lots of drawers and hanging space). I chose this room because it had a bath, but next time, I think I'll ask for the room with the fantastic view of the papal residence because it seemed to be lighter and larger than our room - I know I'll miss the bath, though, and our room did have a lovely 'feel' to it. If you're on a budget, and want to be near the Vatican, go for it. It's a smashing little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: teignmouthlass
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay at Le Suite via venere.com after reading previous reviews on this site. The hotel seemed to offer value for money for Rome, and this did turn out to be the case. Like some others who have written reviews, we arrived to be told there was a problem with our room and for the first night we had to stay at another hotel, a short walk away. This hotel was clean, comfortable and looked like it had a higher rating than Le Suite, so no complaints! Good points about our stay: Staff: Extremely friendly and helpful, providing lots of advice on what to see and do and how to get around the city. Room: A good size, with a great view of the papal residence. Comfortable bed. Clean. Ensuite shower room with a hydro therapy shower. The room had a TV, phone, fridge and safe. There seemed to be air conditioning but as it was November, we didn't need it. Location: Great for the Vatican. Other tourist attractions could be reached on foot, we walked everywhere. The hotel is well located for the metro, buses and trams though as well. There is a cash point right outside, with shops and restaurants in the surrounding streets. The area seemed very safe and was fairly quiet at night. The hotel is quite easy to find, it is one of the first buildings on the left as you turn into Via dei Gracchi (off Via Ottaviano). Breakfast: Plenty to eat, fresh pastries, big cups of coffee, plus juice, yoghurts and toast-like biscuits. Breakfast is served at the time of your choice in the room as the hotel does not have a kitchen or dining room. A few things to consider: If you are tall or of bigger build, you may struggle with the bed, which was quite short and the small shower cubicle. The hotel has a lift, so access is fine. There were steps to be careful of inside the bathroom. There was a smell of drains in the otherwise clean bathroom. There is quite a lot of road noise because of the location, with trams starting to run quite early in the morning. Overall, this is a great hotel for the money and we would stay there.again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: guardiangirl
Reviews.Content: Returned 2 days ago from a 6 day stay in Rome, staying in Le Suite di Via Ottaviano. I found it really difficult to find a hotel in rome, there was so much choice, I didn't know what area to stay in etc. I don't even rememeber how I stumbled across this hotel (booked it through laterooms.com in the end) but like the previous reviewer, it seemed to be relatively cheap (compared to the prices of hotels that would be classed as more central ie close to the Trevi fountain etc) and had very good reviews. I was very pleasantly suprised when I arrived. The hotel is in a big building, but the hotel itself is very very small. I'm sure there's only about 5 rooms! I think I would have had difficulty locating it had we not been dropped off right outside the door by the taxi! (We used Rome cabs-very good service) Angelo, the hotels owner is very very friendly and makes you feel very welcome straight away. He helped us with our luggage, then spent 15-20 minutes going through how to use the metro/buses, how much taxis should cost, where the good restaurants were in the area etc. We had booked a superior room, which was lovely. To be honest I had a quick sneaky peek in the room next door when the door was open and it didnt really seem any different to ours. Our room definitley had the best view which in itself would be worth paying the extra money for. We had the corner room which looked right out onto the papal residence in the Vatican. It was so close, literally a fewminutes walk to St Peters, or a few minutes walk the other way to the entrance to the Vatican Museums. Our room was very nice, not huge, but I have definitley stayed in smaller in city centres. It was always very clean and the bathroom was very modern with a fancy shower which sprayed from all angles!! Breakfast in your room is nothing to shout about, a croissant and drink of your choice. It did me fine though, as you eat like a pig for the rest of the day-you cant help it when in Rome!! I was a bit worried that staying on the other side of the Tiber, close to the Vatican was going to mean that we were far away form everything else. I was pleasantly suprised at how easy it was to get anywhere from our hotel. It was quite a long walk, admittedly, but the whole time we were there we walked everywhere and never used the underground or the buses. The longest walk we took was to the colliseum which took just over an hour. Overall I would say this is a very nice, charming and friendly hotel in an excellent location. I would definitley stay here again if I came to Rome and would reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liz98
Reviews.Content: I can only say what a great find. After reading lots of Hotel reviews for Rome I came across this hotel which seemed to have great reviews without being really expensive. The rooms although quite small are very clean. Breakfast is served in your room and is very basic - ie a couple of croissants and drinks. The only problem we had was finding the Hotel as it's on a side street and is on level 3 of a buidling so there is only a small entrance so my tip would be to find the side street it's located in on a map before you try and find the Hotel. The location is very close to the Vatican and was ideal for travelling around Rome. Rome itself is great and all in all this was one of the best City breaks I have been on.

Reviews.Title: “Good bed :-)”
Reviews.Author: PedroBrazil
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed the during the summer, and this is what we found. Overral, a good place to stay. Highlights -Good location, near to Vatican, San Pietro and Metro (5min walking) -Comfortable bed: best double bed in our trip -Good restaurants nearby – Try “la Cantina de Vito e Dina” -Good bathroom – tub with hydro massage. Lowlights -Breakfast – served in the room, everyday is the same. You might get sick of croissants -Water heating – sometimes the bathroom run out of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: lisajl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Suite from August 1st to August 5th. Our room was lovely, though small, with a great view out the double windows of the street below. The neighborhood was excellent, lots of shops, cafes, gelatos, and an internet cafe close by. The metro was a short walk down the street also. The neighborhood was not over run by tourists, and was very close to the Vatican. We had 3 excellent dinners nearby also. The Asian man who works at Le Suite is a nice person-very accomodating too. He brought us breakfast each morning, which consists of beverages of our choice and cornettos(croissants) which were very tasty. Each day the cornettos were different, for instance once they had cream filling and one day chocolate. My son spilled his chocolate milk on the bed sheets and the staff was totally ok with that. There is a lift up to the 4th floor where Le Suites is located. The kids enjoyed the lift. We had a great time and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Critics_Critic
Reviews.Content: Selected This Hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. The reviews were accurate. Room was clean, as was the bathroom. Some rooms have bathtubs, and others have showers. We got a room with a shower, but it was not facing the street, so it was very quiet. The location to the Vatican is perfect (a 10 minute easy walk). It is a 4 minute walk to the Metro (subway), which takes you wherever you want to go in Rome (will get you to all the tourist sites). They bring you a Continental Breakfast in your room (you tell them the time), and all the beverages, etc. in the refrigerator were less expensive than you could find in the street). This is a small thing, but it is nice when a hotel does not rip you off for the mini bar. Upon your arrival you are greeted at the door of the Hotel (4th floor of a commercial/residential building (don't worry it has an elevator). I should also note that it was very easy to get to the Hotel via the Metro from the Rome Termini Train Station (Romes main train station). If you have alot of luggage, you will be better off taking a taxi (we did not have alot of luggage). In summary, if you are looking for a clean, secure location to stay (not to hang out at, but to get a good nights sleep and "get out to the sites everyday." This is a good choice. If you are looking for a place to hangout, there is no lobby, breakfast room, or any other place to stay except in your room, so this would not be the place for you. Also, you cannot dial out for local calls on the phones in the rooms, so you will need to use their phone in their little office near the entrance. Simply ask them, and they will let you use it. They also prefer Credit Cards and did not accept travelers checks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Hometown_Philly
Reviews.Content: The suites are lovely, located on the 4th floor of a quiet apartment building on lively Ottaviano street. Rooms are exceptionally clean and comfortable and are run by a friendly owner (Angelo) and his staff. The building and suites are also very secure with no worries with regard to the neighborhood, which is safe and convenient. We came and went as we pleased. The rooms are very cozy and are complete with refrigerator and airconditioning to be used as you may require. Breakfast was delivered to our room at our discretion each day, which worked out great for us. The location is a mere block from the Vatican and just three small blocks to the Metro - which zips you into central Rome or Termini Station within moments. Bus stops were also just a few blocks from the Suite. Both are very easy to use. While the streets below are busy with window shoppers and tourists, we found the sounds outside, which included street musicians and Vatican bells, charming. Not at all bothersome, as things quieted down in the evening and we were able to rest without any disturbance. Everything you could want was located nearby and area's such as Trastevere were within an enjoyable 20 minute stroll beyond St. Peter's. We got our excersise walking much of Rome, but it was a great way to soak in such a wonderful city. Plenty of restaurants, cafe's and Gelateria's nearby - even a 24 hour bakery within a few blocks! We were completely satisfied with our stay and recommend Le Suite di via Ottaviano to anyone who is comfortable and happy in an independent setting. We would return on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: UnidosBandidos
Reviews.Content: I was well impressed with this hotel. On arrival I was greeted by one of the friendly staff who showed me the room, handed me the keys and let us settle for the rest of the day before bothering with check-in details. The room was spacious, clean and nicely decorated and I particularly loved the area in which you could look out the window on two seats with a little breakfast table. The bathroom was lovely and pristine clean with a massage shower, bidet and all the usual soaps, toothpaste etc. Breakfast was available up until 9:30 each morning and a call made to the room before bringing the breakfast. The owner and staff were very attentive and polite. I would recommend this to anyone wishing to stay a stone's throw from the Vatican. We walked to the Spanish Steps within approximately 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Right near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Buno
Reviews.Content: This place is not so much a hotel, as it is a small collection of rooms on one floor in an apartment building. Having just opened in the past 1-2 years, it’s not very well known, but we were very happy to have stumbled across it on laterooms.com. Our junior suite was spacious relatively speaking to what you normally get in Rome. It was furnished very nicely and had new bathroom fixtures. Breakfast at a popular nearby café was included. But perhaps the best thing about this hotel is its location – only a couple of blocks away from the Vatican and very conveniently located to the metro. The view out of our 2 big windows was fabulous, and there was no shortage of restaurants, cafes, and shops around. Of the three nights we had booked, we were told that some repairs were being down the first night, so we were put in a nearby hotel which had a much smaller room. Whether that was really the case, or whether they had double booked, we didn’t push. But, you may want to keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Superb little gem!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalifornian
Reviews.Content: European hotels often don't cater to American tastes, but this one fit us superbly. Sparkling clean, beautiflly decorated, with impressively soundproofed windows, and with spacious bathrooms with jaccuzi tubs (wonderful after a long day of hiking around the city). The location is marvelous: literally five minutes to St Peters by foot, in a neighborood with plenty of restaurants, shops, fastfood and bar/cafes. Minutes to buses that take you straight across the Tiber to the heart of ancient Rome, and minutes to the Metro that goes about anywhere a tourist would want. The staff (both of them) are very pleasnt and helpful. The breakfast at a real Italian cafe/bar is a fun experience, lining up along the bar with the real Romans for capuccino and a croissant. This place is a gem (even moreso for the price). We will stay there agian next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Inverclyde
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate my 40th Birthday. The owner organised taxis from and to the airport, although we knew we had to pay 40 euros each way, and was there to greet us when we arrived at 1am. He did not charge us for our use of the mini-bar which was about 7 euros. We were lucky enough to be in St Peters when the new Pope was elected and we could not have had a more convenient or exciting place to stay. I stay in 4 star hotels 2 - 3 times per week and have to say that this little gem put them all to shame. Lovely decor, spotlessly clean and a perfect location. The breakfast of Coffee and Pastry at the Cafe across the street was an enjoyable experience, there are tables in the back, and given the amount we ate at lunch and dinner was just about right. If you want a full English stay in England! We will definetely be going back and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place/Location”
Reviews.Author: marko1974
Reviews.Content: stayed at the suites July 31-august 2nd. This place is a 5 minute walk from st peters square- you can see the papal residence from your window. Location is AWESOME! However, slightly noisy at night since it is on busy street. The rooms are very clean and nice- bathroom with jet tub. Telephone in room did not work. Rememeber, you must pay on arrival in Euro only . Advice- book airport transfers from the suites owner- we loved the ride back to airport in elegant car for 45 euro- we paid 70 euro from the airport to the hotel via taxi- we should have booked pre arranged airport pick up. Overall this is a nice place- very safe- but you are on your own- we rarely saw any employee or owner- you come and go. Air conditioner worked fine. For 90 euro a day - this place cannot be beat. 5 minute walk to ottaviano metro station- great connections to all the sites. the vatican museums are 2 minutes from this place. Only downside to our trip was the weather- scorching heat and humidity. We recommend the suites de via ottaviano!!! Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Suki Pickering
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for a wedding anniversary break. I thought La Suite was lovely - really enjoyed our stay. The room decor was great, perfectly clean and lovely little bathroom. Given the price of 80 pounds per night i thought it was perfect and so much better than staying in the more tourist areas. And at night it was quiet because all tourists are only going to see st peters etcc, Location - very near to St Peters and Vatican City - so perfect for getting up at 7am to get in the queue !!! i highly recommend it otherwise you could be queuing for hours!! Hotel doesn't have trimmings of big hotels but that didn't bother me at all. Rome itself was amazing. The metro system isn't great - but it could be worse. It was easy to get around from Ottoviano to where-ever we needed and cheap - weekend travelcard is only 11 euros and you can travel on any form of transport. And it was so nice to be away from the hustle and bustle. Be aware of rogue taxi drivers - make sure they have a meter - we got almost ripped off once - 5 min journey we were charged 17 euros - real price 7 euros - we managed to haggle but BEWARE !! Don't forget to go to places like Piazza Navona at night- great place to eat and hang out and people watch but you're paying a bit for tourist prices. For a really great dining experience go to Santa Lucia on Largo Febbo - it was an amazing restaurant right next to Raphael Hotel - its a special treat (about 100 UK £ for 2) but the food and service was amazing beyond belief - probably 1 of our best dining experiences ever. Definitely recommend La Suite di via Ottiviano if you don't care about hotel trimmings.We had a big fridge and thats all we needed !! if you book enough in advance request the room with the 4 poster bed- looks v romantic Enjoy Suki

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed three nights and loved it. Abolutely spotless, you could eat your dinner of the floor. The bed was fantastically comfortable and the jacuzzi bath was fab! It is really well located, close to the ottaviano metro station and to St Peters and the Vatican museums. we were a bit worried about the breakfast having read the other reviews, but that was actually the best bit! You really get to live like an italian as you join them in the coffee shop for a coffee and a choice of delicious pastries. Yes, its stand-up, but that all adds to the fun. The coffee shop also sells a lovely range of foods and wines. We would definitely stay here again if we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of luxury...”
Reviews.Author: DANAJJ
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say, I was simply shocked at most reviews when using TripAdvisor to find a decent place to stay in Rome last month. Unless I was prepared to fork out a small fortune for a decent place, most 3 & 4 star hotels priced at a reasonable price seemed to have reviews warning me to stay away. I've been to quite a few European cities, and I'm used to small rooms that you can't swing a cat in, but hey I can live with that. What I can't stand is horrible, dirty rooms, with unpleasant customer service...and that seemed to sum up the hotel reviews in Rome. Then I stumbled on the Ottaviano Suites. It was classed as a B&B when I booked, but in reality it's rather like a small boutique hotel. The suites were ideally located, within a one minute walk to the Vatican and a two minute walk to the train stop that will take you to all the other sites in Rome. It will take you about 20/30 minutes to walk to the centre of Rome, and I'd recommend doing it - you see so much more of the city this way. The room was spotlessly clean on our arrival, and it was kept that way every day too. The bed was fantastically comfortable. The whole suite and the bathroom exuded a plush, luxurious feel. We had breakfast (included in the price) either in the little bar down on the street, opposite the suite, or in the room, if arranged the evening before with the suite's owner. The owner (Angelo) was very helpful, although communication wasn't the easiest as we couldn't speak Italian, and the owner's English was a tad rusty. When we arrived Angelo gave us a map of Rome, and pointed out all the bus/trams routes for us to take to see the main visitor sites and recommended a few places to eat. On the last day of our visit, Angelo also arranged a taxi back to the airport for 40 Euros, he gave us a choice of paying him or the taxi driver so chose to pay Angelo. The next day a taxi was waiting for us without having the hassle of haggling a price with the taxi driver. All in all, a very good choice when staying in Rome, with good customer service added at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “great room, but---”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and very close to the vatican and metro. Very clean and well maintained. Adequate continental breakfast accross the street, but not before 8 am. However, be aware that the owners English is limited and that he does not stay on site, so you MUST make arrangements so that he will be at the facility when you arrive or there is no way to contact him to get into the building. Also his web site advertises that he accepts credit cards but he really wants cash, though the reservation is confirmed with a credit card. He also advertises that he provides COMPLIMENTARY transportation to or from Termini station, but in fact he does not and acts as though he does not understand, perhaps he does not. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A unusual little gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The apartment was cool, clean and quiet. The decor was lovely and the king size bed very comfortable. The jacuzzi shower just has to be experienced. My room was a double but they also had bunk beds in there if you were travelling with children. They even have a fridge in the room with reasonably priced soft drinks, wine & beer or buy your own and keep them cool. The room was fantastic value for money. I booked it on Laterooms. There is a TV with satellite but it has Italian channels only. There is a radio in the room though. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It's in a secure building very close to the Vatican. The staff give you a bunch of keys that allow you access into the building in the evening. You can actually see the Vatican walls from the window and St Peters Square is 5 minutes walk. There is a small market selling everything from pasta to shoes and jewellery. Great shops in the street below the apartment - lots of mens and ladies clothes shops with fantastic prices. The side streets are full of lovely little food and drink shops. 2 min walk to the Ottaviano metro stop which takes you to all the major attractions in a few minutes.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Suite di Via Ottaviano
HotelInfo.Address: Via Dei Gracchi 6, 00192 Rome, Italy
